situation: T was becoming frustrated and angry as his handwriting kept smudging during a written task, affecting his concentration and output.
action: To help T, the TA provided a pencil grip and some extra writing material designed to accommodate his needs. She encouraged him to use a slant board to help improve his control and posture while writing. With these adjustments, T found writing less frustrating and was able to concentrate more effectively.
effect: T's writing improved, and he completed the task with much clearer handwriting. The accommodations helped reduce his frustration, boosting his confidence and willingness to engage in written assignments.
